definition: to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: Jim felt being razzed at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻吉姆感觉自己被嘲弄了。

sentences.english: Those who belonged to the higher classes were subjected to taunts and ridicule.
sentences.chinese: 属于上层社会的一些穆斯林会被嘲弄，被奚落。

sentences.english: Do not mock my grey beard, Tarkaan though you be.
sentences.chinese: 别嘲弄我这把白胡子了，尽管你是位泰坎。

sentences.english: You must not tease a child because it stutters.
sentences.chinese: 你切不可因孩子口吃而嘲弄他。

sentences.english: We'll be working on Mocking-up the creature on the landscape in the following steps.
sentences.chinese: 我们将努力嘲弄行动的生物景观有以下几个步骤。

sentences.english: Before being liberated from slavery, these people had been scorned and used and treated as outcasts.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人脱离奴役前，饱受嘲弄利用，被视作贱民。

sentences.english: The three boys poked fun at the little girl.
In deep derision outlaughs the foeman.
sentences.chinese: 敌人极尽嘲弄地纵声大笑。

sentences.english: Prince Charles does not escape mild mockery .
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯王子也难逃人们小小的嘲弄。

sentences.english: Here comes the little fenian , they'd jeer.
sentences.chinese: 他们会嘲弄地说，“小芬尼亚来了。”

sentences.english: All these peculiarities of his style have been parodied by his assailants.
sentences.chinese: 他的所有这些风格特征都受到攻击者模仿嘲弄。

sentences.english: Ali G guyed celebrities on his show.
sentences.chinese: 阿里克在节目中嘲弄了一众名流。

sentences.english: I am afraid senilly, until realizes is obtaining the wisdom every day.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕嘲弄，直到学会自我解嘲。

sentences.english: Your brain pokes you and says “see told you so.”
sentences.chinese: 你的大脑嘲弄你说“看吧，早告诉你了。”

sentences.english: The strategic value of the island was derisive .
sentences.chinese: 这个海岛的战略价值嘲弄。

sentences.english: I'll pause here to let the derisive laughter die down.
sentences.chinese: 我将在此稍作停顿，让嘲弄的笑声平息。

definition: to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
